comments.raw_text:
Windows Internet Explorer places a SourceURL Property in the description section of the CF_HTML format. 

This allows handlers of CF_HTML to resolve relative links within a file (such as when CF_HTML text is pasted into a DHTML Edit Control host).

Our current handling though ignores this relative link and so the links are handled wrongly when pasted from IE.

Reference: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa767917(v=vs.85).aspx
comments.author: netzen@gmail.com

comments.text:
Just to add a bit more info...

When you paste an absolute URL from URL1 on IE into an editable field of URL2 on Firefox it keeps the URL absolute.  So in effect to the end user the newly pasted URL no longer points to the correct domain.  

We should be resolving these to absolute URLs if the SourceURL CF_HTML field is specified.  

Chrome and IE both work correctly in that respect.
